meanings.definition: To free someone from a mistaken belief or idea.
meanings.sent1: She disabused him of the notion that all snakes are dangerous.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disabused the students of the myth that Pluto is still a planet.
meanings.sent3: After showing him a harmless snake, she disabused him of his fear of all serpents.
meanings.sent4: Her calm explanation disabused him of the idea that all spiders are poisonous.
meanings.sent5: The documentary disabused viewers of the misconception that all sharks are man-eaters.

meanings.definition: To correct a false impression or misconception.
meanings.sent1: He disabused his friend of the mistaken belief that all cats are aloof.
meanings.sent2: The article disabused readers of the false notion that vaccines cause autism.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick disabused the audience of the idea that he could read minds.
meanings.sent4: Her honest feedback disabused him of the misconception that he was a great singer.
meanings.sent5: The experiment disabused scientists of the incorrect theory they had been following.
